intro: Dinochloa tjankorreh var. andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman hill balsam, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the family Limnanthaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. It has hairy, elongated leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
